sentences.en: A $ 10 , 000 bond was furnished by an alderman.
sentences.cn: 一位市议员提供了一万美元的保证金.

sentences.en: After a full hearing, the alderman gave it as his opinion.
sentences.cn: 参事先生听了全部报告之后,说出了他的意见.
高级市政官在市议会主持事务.

sentences.en: Alderman says that eating less salt results in lower blood pressure.
sentences.cn: 阿尔德曼教授说少吃盐可以降低血压.

sentences.en: As an alderman, he should always have the lives of the people in his mind.
sentences.cn: 作为一任地方官, 应时刻把民命民生放在心间.

sentences.en: By the time you are forty, you will be as fat as an alderman.
sentences.cn: 你到了40岁, 一定会变得大腹便便的.

sentences.en: McGee was pulled over minutes later and that's where the versions the alderman and police diverge.
sentences.cn: 麦吉是退出了几分钟后,这是在版本的阿尔德曼和警察的分歧.

sentences.en: Michael Alderman is a mond of among the critics.
sentences.cn: 迈克尔·奥德曼也是反对者之一.

sentences.en: The alderman had hunderds of people at his feet.
sentences.cn: 数以百计的人都拜倒在这位议员的权势之下.

sentences.en: The alderman was respected by the citizens.
sentences.cn: 这位市议员受到市民的敬重.

words.tran_cn: 市府参事的；市议员的；市长助理的
市议员；总督；市府参事；高级市政官

trans.tran_en: an elected member of a town or city council in the US
